dgantt
Class TextUtilities

java.lang.Object
  dgantt.TextUtilities

public class TextUtilities
extends java.lang.Object

Provides lightweight plain text rendering methods. Specifically, provides methods to render single-line strings and multi-line text inside a rectangle. Ellipsis replace text not contained in the given region.

clipString

public static java.lang.String clipString(javax.swing.JComponent c,
                                          java.awt.FontMetrics fm,

findFontSize

public static int findFontSize(java.awt.Graphics g,
                               java.lang.String text,
                               java.awt.Rectangle bounds,
                               int minSize,
                               int maxSize)
Determines the optimal font size for fitting the given text inside the given bounds. A binary search is used between minSize and maxSize.

Parameters:
g - graphics target
text - string to render
bounds - rectangle in which to render text
minSize - minimum font size
maxSize - maximum font size
Returns:
optimal font size

getLineBreakIndex

public static int getLineBreakIndex(java.awt.Graphics g,
                                    java.lang.String text,
                                    int index,
                                    double maxWidth)
Computes the index of the next line break. Similar to LineBreakMeasurer but modified due to a flaw in Sun's implementation.

Parameters:
g - graphics target
text - string to render
index - last line break index
maxWidth - maximum width of rendered line
Returns:
index of next line break

isComplexLayout

public static final boolean isComplexLayout(char[] text,
                                            int start,
                                            int limit)

isTextInBounds

public static boolean isTextInBounds(java.awt.Graphics g,
                                     java.lang.String text,
                                     java.awt.Rectangle bounds)
Returns true if the text can be rendered inside a given bounds without clipping; false otherwise.

Parameters:
g - graphics target
text - string to render
bounds - rectangle in which to render text
Returns:
boolean indicating text is renderable in bounds

paintString

public static void paintString(java.awt.Graphics g,
                               java.lang.String text,
                               java.awt.geom.Point2D p)
Renders a single line of text. Differs from Graphics.drawString(...) by anchoring rendered text at the upper-left corner rather than the baseline.

Parameters:
g - graphics target
text - string to render
p - upper-left corner of rendered text

paintString

public static void paintString(java.awt.Graphics g,
                               java.lang.String text,
                               java.awt.Rectangle bounds,
                               int halign,
                               int valign)
Renders a single line of text. The text is rendered inside a bounding box allowing alignment and clipping.

Parameters:
g - graphics target
text - string to render
bounds - rectangle in which to render text
halign - horizontal alignment, either LEFT, CENTER, RIGHT
valign - vertical alignment, either TOP, CENTER, BOTTOM

paintString

public static void paintString(java.awt.Graphics g,
                               java.lang.String text,
                               java.awt.Rectangle bounds,
                               int halign,
                               int valign,
                               boolean force)
Renders a single line of text. The text is rendered inside a bounding box allowing alignment and clipping.

Parameters:
g - graphics target
text - string to render
bounds - rectangle in which to render text
halign - horizontal alignment, either LEFT, CENTER, RIGHT
valign - vertical alignment, either TOP, CENTER, BOTTOM
force - force rendering of string even if it doesn't fit in bounds

paintText

public static void paintText(java.awt.Graphics g,
                             java.lang.String text,
                             java.awt.Rectangle bounds,
                             int halign,
                             int valign)
Renders multi-line text.

Parameters:
g - graphics target
text - string to render
bounds - rectangle in which to render text
halign - horizontal alignment, either LEFT, CENTER, RIGHT
valign - vertical alignment, either TOP, CENTER, BOTTOM

splitText

                                                            java.lang.String text,
                                                            java.awt.Rectangle bounds)
Splits text into individual lines fitting in a given rectangular bounds.

Parameters:
g - graphics target
text - string to render
bounds - rectangle in which to render text
Returns:
list of individual lines
